parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions the author's intention to run for a public office ("viitor deputat"). While not naming a specific party, the hashtags include "#PNCR", which refers to the Partidul Național Conservator Român.  The image shows the candidate at a PNCR event, further strengthening this connection.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The language used ("Dragi prieteni," "noi toți," "viitorul României") also indicates an attempt to address the general public.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post proposes a legislative initiative (mandatory psychological evaluation for public office candidates), its primary purpose appears to be promoting the candidate's image and platform.  The call to action ("Aștept cu interes opiniile voastre") and the emphasis on creating a "responsible" political class could be interpreted as an attempt to garner support for the candidate's candidacy. The overall tone and message aim to present the candidate as competent and responsible, which is a common tactic in electoral campaigns.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents a policy proposal, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The language is persuasive and promotional, focusing on the candidate's personal views and aspirations rather than providing balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. Although presented as a policy proposal, the context of a paid Facebook advertisement by a political candidate strongly suggests that the "personal opinion" is strategically crafted to influence voters' perceptions and ultimately, their votes.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>946373124019157</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while ostensibly presenting a policy proposal, functions as electoral propaganda.  It leverages a paid Facebook advertisement to promote a political candidate (Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop) affiliated with the PNCR party. The content, while framed as a policy initiative, is designed to enhance the candidate's image and appeal to voters. The call to action and the overall tone strongly suggest an intention to influence the election outcome. The use of hashtags further reinforces the promotional nature of the post.  The image further confirms the candidate's affiliation with the PNCR.  While the post doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for the candidate, the implicit message is clear:  supporting this policy proposal is tantamount to supporting the candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Pop Sebastian Tiberiu], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 946373124019157), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși prezentată ca o propunere legislativă, constituie propagandă electorală. Postarea, cu cheltuieli sub 100 RON, vizează promovarea candidatului Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop, afiliat PNCR, prin accentuarea competenței și responsabilității sale.  Efectul electoral este evident, având în vedere că postarea este direcționată către un public larg, utilizând un limbaj persuasiv și apelând la emoții.  Mesajul implicit este că susținerea propunerii legislative echivalează cu susținerea candidaturii.  Prezența hashtag-urilor #PNCR și imaginea atașată confirmă afilierea politică.  Contact: contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro, +40760256257.  Numărul de impresii este estimat la 1000-2000.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
